## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
d <- USArrests
head(d, n = 6)
```

```{r}
x <- d$UrbanPop #Elegimos x
y <- d$Murder #Elegimos y
plot(x, y, xlab = 'UrbanPop', ylab = 'Murder')
```

```{r}
x <- d$Assault #Elegimos x
y <- d$Murder #Elegimos y
plot(x, y, xlab = 'Assault', ylab = 'Murder')
```

```{r}
plot(d)
```

```{r}
summary(d)
```

```{r}
#calculo directo de la varianza y cuasivarianza para Murder

n <- length(d)

```

> Hola

```{r}
# Define the x values
x <- seq(-pi, pi, length.out = 100)

# Calculate the sine of x
y <- sin(x)

# Get the upper part of the sine function
y_upper <- pmax(y, 0)

# Plot the upper part of the sine function
plot(x, y_upper, type = "l", ylim = c(-1, 1))
```
